page.title: 14 THE AUCTION MART
page.content: The door swung open as more farmers came bustling in. They had come to see the selection of sheep for sale. The auctioneer had just sold some sheep. They were quickly rushed out of the ring and some more sheep were brought in. The auctioneer began to shout the prices for the sheep. Nobody seemed to be interested. Then a farmer made a sign to show that he wanted to buy the sheep. Another farmer started to bid for the sheep. Both put up strong opposition against each other. In the end the one who had started second got the sheep. A man who sat next to the auctioneer was writing down who had got the sheep and for how much. The hammer like object banged down. One brown and white ewe was sold for ten pounds.Everyone began to disperse and the sheep were loaded onto wagons. The Auction Mart had now finished.
